Package controller

Class FlappyBirdGameController

java.lang.Object
controller.FlappyBirdGameController
public class FlappyBirdGameController extends Object
The FlappyBirdGameController class contains the logic for starting, running, and ending the gameplay of Flappy Bird
Version:
July 21, 2024
Author:
Andrew Polyak

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    FlappyBirdGameController(javafx.scene.layout.AnchorPane gameScreen, javafx.scene.layout.AnchorPane postGameScreen, javafx.scene.text.Text gameEndHighScore, javafx.scene.text.Text gameEndLastScore, javafx.scene.text.Text mainMenuHighScoreCounter, Bird bird, javafx.scene.text.Text scoreCounter, Tube topTubeOne, Tube topTubeTwo, Tube topTubeThree, Tube bottomTubeOne, Tube bottomTubeTwo, Tube bottomTubeThree)
    The FlappyBirdGameController constructor initializes all elements related to running a Flappy Bird game

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    private boolean
    birdTouchingTube()
    The birdTouchingTube method checks whether the bird has collided with any tube hit box, and returns true if so, false otherwise
    private boolean
    birdTouchingWall()
    The birdTouchingWall method checks if the bird's y-coordinates have exceeded the boundaries of the top or bottom of the screen, and returns true if so, false otherwise
    private void
    endGameListener()
    The endGameListener method ends the game if the bird collides with the floor, ceiling, or any tube
    private boolean
    flapComplete()
    The flapComplete method returns true if the bird's y-coordinate height has met or exceeded it's maximum y-coordinate per rise relative to it's y-coordinate when the rise began and returns false if the maximum has not been exceeded yet
    private void
    incrementScoreListener()
    The incrementScoreListener method adds +1 to the score if the bird successfully passed through a pair of tubes
    private void
    moveBirdListener()
    The moveBirdListener method listens for a space bar press from the user to initialize a flap
    Once the bird is ready to flap, the Bird class's rise method will be called to allow the bird to rise
    The flapComplete method will be called to check if the bird has reached the maximum height allowed by a single flap
    Once the maximum flap height is reached, the Bird class's fall method will be called too allow the bird to fall
    The bird will rotate upward during rising and downward during falling to give the animation some more life
    private void
    moveTubes()
    The moveTubes method contains the logic for infinitely moving and respawning the tubes so the gameplay can continue indefinitely
    void
    play()
    The play method sets up UI elements related to gameplay, gives an initial flap to the bird, and calls the AnimationTimer handler override method
    private void
    respawnTubes(boolean respawnOne, boolean respawnTwo, boolean respawnThree)
    The respawnTubes method takes in a boolean value to represent which pair of tubes should be respawned, and respawns them at the beginning of their cycle in a random position (i.e., gap is near top, near bottom, or in middle)
    private void
    setTubeHeight(Tube topTube, Tube bottomTube, int modifier)
    The setTubeHeight method takes in a tube pair and a randomly generated modifier, then sets the tube's heights accordingly
    private boolean
    tubesAtScreenEnd(Tube topTube)
    The tubesAtScreenEnd method checks if a tube pair (just checking topTube is enough, since the bottomTube is synced) has reached the end of the screen)
    private boolean
    tubesMaxDistanceApart(Tube delayedTube, Tube movingTube)
    The tubesMaxDistanceApart method checks whether the non-moving tube is TUBES_MAX_DISTANCE_APART away from the moving tube
    private boolean
    tubesPassedBird(Tube topTube)
    The tubesPassedBird method checks if the tubes have successfully passed by the bird without the bird hitting them (true) or not (false)
    private void
    updateHighScore()
    The updateHighScore method displays the user's achieved score and high score on the game-end screen
    If the user has achieved a new high score, this is reflected in the game-end screen and is saved to the user's high-score database

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • FlappyBirdGameController

  • Method Details

    • play

      public void play()
      The play method sets up UI elements related to gameplay, gives an initial flap to the bird, and calls the AnimationTimer handler override method

    • moveBirdListener

      private void moveBirdListener()
      The moveBirdListener method listens for a space bar press from the user to initialize a flap
      Once the bird is ready to flap, the Bird class's rise method will be called to allow the bird to rise
      The flapComplete method will be called to check if the bird has reached the maximum height allowed by a single flap
      Once the maximum flap height is reached, the Bird class's fall method will be called too allow the bird to fall
      The bird will rotate upward during rising and downward during falling to give the animation some more life

    • moveTubes

      private void moveTubes()
      The moveTubes method contains the logic for infinitely moving and respawning the tubes so the gameplay can continue indefinitely

    • respawnTubes

      private void respawnTubes(boolean respawnOne, boolean respawnTwo, boolean respawnThree)
      The respawnTubes method takes in a boolean value to represent which pair of tubes should be respawned, and respawns them at the beginning of their cycle in a random position (i.e., gap is near top, near bottom, or in middle)

    • setTubeHeight

      private void setTubeHeight(Tube topTube, Tube bottomTube, int modifier)
      The setTubeHeight method takes in a tube pair and a randomly generated modifier, then sets the tube's heights accordingly
      Parameters:
      topTube -
      bottomTube -
      modifier -

    • incrementScoreListener

      private void incrementScoreListener()
      The incrementScoreListener method adds +1 to the score if the bird successfully passed through a pair of tubes

    • endGameListener

      private void endGameListener()
      The endGameListener method ends the game if the bird collides with the floor, ceiling, or any tube

    • flapComplete

      private boolean flapComplete()
      The flapComplete method returns true if the bird's y-coordinate height has met or exceeded it's maximum y-coordinate per rise relative to it's y-coordinate when the rise began and returns false if the maximum has not been exceeded yet
      Returns:
      true if the max flap height is met, false otherwise

    • tubesMaxDistanceApart

      private boolean tubesMaxDistanceApart(Tube delayedTube, Tube movingTube)
      The tubesMaxDistanceApart method checks whether the non-moving tube is TUBES_MAX_DISTANCE_APART away from the moving tube
      Parameters:
      delayedTube -
      movingTube -
      Returns:
      true if the max distance has been met or exceeded, false otherwise

    • tubesAtScreenEnd

      private boolean tubesAtScreenEnd(Tube topTube)
      The tubesAtScreenEnd method checks if a tube pair (just checking topTube is enough, since the bottomTube is synced) has reached the end of the screen)
      Parameters:
      bottomTube -
      topTube -
      Returns:
      true if the tube has reached LEFT_WALL, false otherwise

    • tubesPassedBird

      private boolean tubesPassedBird(Tube topTube)
      The tubesPassedBird method checks if the tubes have successfully passed by the bird without the bird hitting them (true) or not (false)
      Parameters:
      bottomTube -
      topTube -
      Returns:
      true if the tubes successfully passed by the bird, false otherwise

    • updateHighScore

      private void updateHighScore()
      The updateHighScore method displays the user's achieved score and high score on the game-end screen
      If the user has achieved a new high score, this is reflected in the game-end screen and is saved to the user's high-score database

    • birdTouchingWall

      private boolean birdTouchingWall()
      The birdTouchingWall method checks if the bird's y-coordinates have exceeded the boundaries of the top or bottom of the screen, and returns true if so, false otherwise
      Returns:
      true if the bird's y-coordinates exceeded the bottom or top wall, false otherwise

    • birdTouchingTube

      private boolean birdTouchingTube()
      The birdTouchingTube method checks whether the bird has collided with any tube hit box, and returns true if so, false otherwise
      Returns:
      true if the bird collided with a tube, false otherwise
